description: Light fruit flavors of watermelon and strawberry, along with some thin black cherry and cola flavors are what you'll find here. This is pleasant and drinkable, but not a wine to cellar or match with any really spicy foods. A good quaffer.

title: Butterfield Station 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Simple and soft, with buttery citrus flavors. Would score higher, but the wine falls apart on the finish.

title: Besserat de Bellefon NV Cuvée des Moines Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This is a soft, creamed apple wine, with touches of toast. It has a great lemon zest character that brings freshness as well as brilliant acidity. The finish is textured, very fresh.

title: River Road 2011 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This tastes bone dry and silky, and it comes with Russian River's tart acidity. The cherry and cola flavors could be more concentrated, but it does have some elegance.

title: Balletto 2011 Burnside Road Vineyard Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: With an alcohol reading of only 13.3%, this Pinot offers a refreshingly light alternative to darker, heavier bottlings in California. It's silky in the mouth, despite some firm tannins, with subtle, complex raspberry, red currant, tobacco, mushroom, balsam and spice flavors. Lovely now, and should have no trouble developing in the bottle over the next eight years.

title: Château la Gaffelière 2011  Saint-Émilion
description: A hugely concentrated wine, it has a dark feel to it, mineral and structured. It shows spice, suggestions of the wood aging and always the ripest fruit. Drink from 2018.

title: Paraschos 2009 Ponka White (Venezia Giulia)
description: This vino naturale (the wine is not filtered and has no added sulfites) opens with intense aromas of butterscotch, candied fruit, apricot and honey. The blend is Chardonnay, Sauvignon and Malvasia, and it tastes slightly oxidized overall.

title: Donum 2010 Reserve Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: As ripe as Donum's regular 2010 Russian River Pinot is, this reserve is even richer. It's certainly impressive for sheer power, but is too much of a good thing, flooding the mouth with so much soft, ripe, oaky raspberry and cherry flamboyance as to lose subtlety.

title: Rutherford Grove 2006 Rutherford Bench Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Made in an interesting way, with no oak but aged on the lees and put through malolactic fermentation. The result is crisp, clean and tasty, if a little sweet, with citrus, fig, green melon, vanilla and spice flavors.

title: Bogle 2010 Merlot (California)
description: Dry, tart and simple, this has a flavor of sour cherry candy. A fine wine for pouring at big parties.

title: Franciscan 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Smooth and oaky, this value-minded wine offers varietal notes of cassis and cranberry, with traces of dried herb, cedar and pencil lead. A heftier midpalate strengthens in the glass before a long, clove-infused finish.

title: Carter Estate 2012 Blanc de Blanc Chardonnay (South Coast)
description: Tight and fresh aromas of Asian pear, honeysuckle and key lime pie converge on this sparkler from a new estate in Temecula. The palate shows sliced apples, yellow pears, ripe nectarine, rounder white peach and even creamy cherimoya flavors. Though the region is known more for almond-flavored sparklers, they seem to do regular bubbles well.

title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2010 Wolff Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: A well-balanced Chardonnay, this has flavors of tropical fruit, apricot and lemon candy, brightened by that famous Edna Valley acidity. This would make for a great apéritif.

title: Cayuse 2014 Camaspelo Red (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: The aromas are light, with notes of moist earth, smoke, cassis, herb and berry. The saline and fruit flavors are silky in feel, bringing a sense of concentration and texture that keeps the interest high. There's plenty of minerality throughout along with a lengthy finish.

title: Domaine Berthet-Bondet 2012 Chardonnay (Côtes du Jura)
description: The wine has toast, vanilla and pear flavors, still young and tightly closed. It needs several months to begin to open up and to show its intrinsic fruitiness and potential richness. Drink from 2015.

title: Martin Ranch 2013 Thérèse Vineyards Dos Niñas Vineyard Sangiovese (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Rustic aromas of crushed rocks and chewing tobacco pair interestingly with more floral elements of rose petal, lilac and wisteria on the nose of this bottling. Coffee and tobacco flavors show on the palate, where muddy tannins present leathery flavors of dark red cherries. It shows its long barrel aging with pride.

title: Maison Champy 2006  Mazis-Chambertin
description: A dense, almost heavy wine, with smoky, licorice flavors that dominate the fruit. It is firm, big, solid, the sort of wine that demands attention with its concentration and powered structure. It may need time for aging, but already the power and weight are there.

title: Rex Hill 2011 Alloro Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Since last reviewed in 2008, the Alloro Vineyard's grapes seem to have gained in complexity and sophistication. Elegant and fine tuned, this new release combines scents and accents of rose petals, wet rock and raspberries with generous, supporting acidity. The finish extends gracefully with the finesse of Premier Cru Burgundy.

title: Mill Creek 2005 Kreck Family Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Soft and ripe in extracted cherry and blackberry jam fruit, this also has some heat on the palate, the result of 15% alcohol. It feels a little simple, and the heat is off-putting.

title: Swanson 2008 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)
description: Tastes old, even though it's only from 2008, with some oxidized notes. It's a bone-dry wine, but those citrus and flower flavors are tired.

title: Elsom Cellars 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This Cabernet blend includes about 20% Syrah in the mix, which perhaps contributes to a lack of varietal character. It seems to be in a dumb phase, with no specific aromas and nondescript fruit. The finish turns acidic and chalky.

title: Villa Pillo 2008 Sant'Adele Merlot (Toscana)
description: Here's a quality Merlot offered at a very reasonable low price. Sant'Adele is rich, succulent and smooth with bursting aromas of cherry, blueberry, spice and moist tobacco. Pair this wine with homemade roast chicken and garlic potatoes.

title: Viansa 2005 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: A bit too soft, which makes the exceptionally ripe blackberry and chocolate flavors stand alone and lack structure. Tasty and flashy, but the palate longs for more acids and tannins.

title: Castello di Verrazzano 2004 Sassello Sangiovese (Toscana)
description: Sassello is Sangiovese from a high hillside vineyard that offers pretty spice renderings and good dimension overall. Its blackberry, Amaretto, natural rubber and moist earth aromas and flavors offer plenty of complexity.

title: Renwood 2012 Premier Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Very fruity and fresh but also smooth and supple, this full-bodied wine smells like ripe raspberries. Likewise, tastes recall raspberries and red cherries. and feel firm and grippy enough to counterbalance the ripeness and body. It's a very sleek but very big mouthful.

title: Center of Effort 2014 Effort Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: For the winery's lower-priced offering, this is a stunner. Baked black cherry, vanilla, raspberry, rose petals and a touch of licorice light up the nose. The lightly poised but intensely focused sip reveals a wild combo of fruit and spice, with sage, bay leaf, thyme and fennel laced through black cherry. It's like walking through the Central Coast scrubland.

title: Simi 2005 Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: A solid everyday Merlot that offers plenty of ripe berry, cherry and smoky oak flavors now. Dry and tannic, it has enough stuffing and class to pair with a nice steak.

title: Cooper-Garrod 2009 George's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This patiently aged wine boasts an amazing nose of dried olallieberry fruit leather, chocolate-cherry sauce, vanilla extract and exotic black spices, showing its years in only the best ways. It's surprisingly lean on the palate at first, then evolves into red cherries and plums, with well-integrated dried oregano and black pepper spices.

title: Louis Latour 2014 La Grande Roche Premier Cru  (Montagny)
description: The appellation in the Côte Chalonnaise only produces white wine. This wine has a smooth and creamy character with attractive acidity and bright acidity. It is a perfumed wine just hinting at a more mineral texture. Drink from 2017.

title: Domaine Rossignol-Trapet 2011 Petite Chapelle Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: From vines just below the line of Grand Cru vineyards, this is a big and powerful expression of Pinot Noir. It is dense with firm tannins that are embedded in the ripe black fruits. It's a complex wine, serious while still fruity, and needing to age. Drink from  2018.

title: François Millet 2015 Domaine des Côtes Blanches  (Sancerre)
description: Pure fruitiness holds the balance of this wine between crisp acidity and a tightly mineral texture. It comes from the producer's Bué vineyards, one of the top villages of Sancerre. The wine is crisp, made to be drunk young and fruity.

title: Culton 2013 Mercenary Glenrose Vineyard Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 50% Mourvèdre, 38% Syrah and 12% Grenache is fairly light on the nose, showing smoked beef, soy and black-plum paste. The flavors are also quite restrained, with leather, blackberry, fennel and wild-mint elements.

title: Force Majeure 2009 Collaboration Series I Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)
description: Still the best wine in the lineup, this Bordeaux-style blend, made by Cadence's Ben Smith, is two-thirds Cabernet Sauvignon, which is sourced from some of the oldest vines on Red Mountain, planted in 1975 and 1982. Concentrated, tannic and dense, it matches the superb fruit with captivating notes of seed bread and cayenne pepper.

title: I Sodi 2009  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico
description: Made with dried grapes—67% Malvasia and 33% Trebbiano—this meditation wine opens with intense aromas of maple syrup, carob and crushed raw almond. The concentrated palate doles out dried apricot, chestnut honey and toasted hazelnut while fresh acidity balances the sweet flavors.

title: Poggio Stenti 2013 Tribulo  (Montecucco)
description: Aromas of black cherry, tilled soil and a hint of dark spice lift out of the glass. The palate offers juicy wild cherry, cinnamon and white pepper while smooth tannins lend a polished texture.

title: Château Brande-Bergère 2015 Cuvée O'Byrne  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: This is a smoky wine, with ripe berry fruits and balanced wood flavors. The solid tannins lend structure and backbone to the palate, while the finish is rich. Drink from 2018.

title: Salvioni 2008  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Bright cherry and blue floral aromas come with hints of leather and spice. The vibrant palate delivers succulent wild cherry and white pepper restrained by fresh acidity and bracing tannins. It has mesmerizing depth, finesse and balance. Drink 2015–2028.

title: Hanna 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Soft in tannins and acids, this Cabernet has a gentle, drink-me-now mouthfeel. The flavors are rich and sweet in milk chocolate, blueberries and blackberries. Easy to like, if a little pricey for what you get.

title: Domaine Fouassier 2014 Les Romains  (Sancerre)
description: Grown on southwest-facing slopes, this is a ripe, full wine with a natural warmth as well as a mineral texture. It is still tight and needs to age with its gooseberry and herbal edge as well as more flinty, smoky background. Drink from 2017.

title: Cherry Tart 2014 Chardonnay (California)
description: Big and flavorful, this full-bodied wine boasts butter, toast and smoke nuances layered over ripe pear and marzipan flavors. Fermented in stainless steel but aged in French oak, it has a rich texture and overt sweetness without going to extremes.

title: Boekenoogen 2013 3 Clone Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This clonal combo from a meticulously tended family vineyard shows iron, cranberry, strawberry blossoms, sagebrush and a wound-up minerality on the nose. Sanguine flavors power the tip of the palate alongside cranberry and pomegranate fruit. A suave spiciness of dried mint and menthol emerges in the midpalate.

title: Louis Latour 2014 Les Quatre Journaux  (Romanée-St.-Vivant)
description: A Journal is an old Burgundian measurement for just under one acre. From a portion of this Grand Cru vineyard, this wine is perfumed, powerful and has great concentration. Already it is showing dark fruits, ripe plum and good texture. Acidity cuts through the wine, giving a great lift at the end. Drink from 2022.

title: Château de Chambrun 2011  Lalande de Pomerol
description: This is a soft ripe wine. It has generous helpings of Merlot that give red fruit and rich acidity. The wine is soft for the vintage and is all ready to drink.

title: Ponzi 2014 Abetina Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Focused and dense, this intense wine captures the essence of ripe raspberries. Aged in 50% new French oak, it's got a strong vein of coffee and mocha. The flavors broaden out and penetrate, finishing with highlights of cedar, cinnamon and dark chocolate. Drink now through the 2020s, but decant if you want the full expression.

title: Château Bardins 2013  Pessac-Léognan
description: This wine is lean, austere with high acidity that leaves fruit well behind. It is structured and dry, only hinting at black-currant freshness. This third-generation family estate also hosts monthly musical and tasting events and sells fruit, vegetables and honey.

title: MacPhail 2010 Wightman House Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This explodes with ripe raspberry, strawberry and cherry flavors, while the heat from the alcohol gives it the headiness of a liqueur. It's definitely not a subtle wine, but one to enjoy now with grilled tuna, lamb or wild mushroom risotto.

title: Ghost Pines 2013 Winemaker's Blend Pinot Noir (Sonoma County-Monterey County)
description: Damp forest and dried cherry with cranberry combine on the nose and palate in this wine, sourced predominantly from Monterey County. Soft and silky it risks veering off balance once the oak begins to unwrap, becoming quite burly on the finish.

title: Etude 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Black pepper and juicy blueberry expand on the palate in this juicy, plush and likable 100% varietal wine, accented in full-bodied ripeness and wafts of vanilla smoke.

title: W.H. Smith 2009 Bronze Label Piedra Hill Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: This Cabernet shows the austerity and dry tannins of a Howell Mountain wine, as well as a fine streak of acidity and oak. It has a blunt core of red currants and mocha. Seems to want some time, so give it 4–6 years to settle down.

title: La Poderina 2008 Poggio Abate Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)
description: Round and velvety, it has aromas of ripe berry, chocolate and exotic spices. The rich palate delivers juicy black cherry punctuated with ground black pepper, cinnamon, carob, pipe tobacco and mint. Forward and sweet, this is already extremely accessible so enjoy soon. Drink through 2018.

title: Château Grand Bourgeau 2014  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This wine offers touches of tropical fruits as well as a crisper edge of citrus and herbal flavors. It is a lightly textured, tangy and very fresh 100% Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now.

title: Love & Squalor 2013 Riesling (Willamette Valley)
description: This packs tremendous flavor into a low-alcohol wine with moderate residual sugar. Peach pit and juice, green apple and citrusy acids start it off. The flavors keep going through a long, complex finish, adding subtle notes of herb and cut grass.

title: Holly's Hill 2012 Petit Patriarche Red (El Dorado)
description: This wine packs a big wallop of superripe flavors, so it doesn't taste as petite as its name. Aromas like raisins and rhubarb lead to deep, overripe fruit flavors recalling prunes and dried cherries. An overall feeling of full body persists, but without much tannin to support it.

title: Origin 2014 Johan Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is showing a bit of muscle, and some still-integrating barrel flavors, but it's already a wine that delivers plenty of pleasure. Forgive the flaky faux-wax topping (not thick enough to be called a real capsule) and enjoy the well-ripened blackberry fruit, the nicely-layered creamy chocolate, the touch of underbrush and the appealing length. Drink now through 2022.

title: Fattoria San Michele a Torri 2013 Tenuta La Gabbiola  (Chianti Classico)
description: Enticing scents of blue flower, plum, blackberry and dried herb come together on this. The fresh, chewy palate offers dried black cherry, anise and tobacco set against a backbone of assertive tannins and zesty acidity.

title: Mettler Family Vineyards 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: The cassis, black currant, chocolate and sweet oak flavors star in this soft, easy wine. It could use a firmer structure, but it's very savory and easy to drink.

title: Ardenvoir 2009 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A new offering from Ardenvoir, this Chardonnay is as Burgundian as any in Washington. Fine, tart and racy fruit is married to top-notch French oak. The meld of vivid apple and citrus flavors to mineral-soaked acidity and a frame of toasted coconut is marvelously seductive. Ageworthy but already delicious.

title: Verget 2008 Clos Saint-Pierre  (Mâcon-Charnay)
description: Ripe, full-bodied wine, the fresh white currant and pear fruits layered with wood. The wine is bright with good concentration. Screwcap.

title: Revival 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a satisfying, small-production wine from four rows of the family's Kairos Vineyard, a study in sanguine intensity. Currant, cassis and tar integrate with the body of subtle oak and tannin, finishing in a sprinkling of dried herb and graphite.

title: Poliziano 2011  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Aromas of iris, violet and dark berry slowly take shape in the glass. The firm palate offers fleshy black cherry, plum, espresso, tobacco and a hint of vanilla alongside firm tannins. Drink through 2019.

title: Efeste 2014 Lola Evergreen Vineyard Chardonnay (Ancient Lakes)
description: The aromas of mineral, spice, toast, yellow apple and lemon pith are light but enchanting. The palate is medium bodied and refined, demonstrating judicious use of oak and a lengthy finish that shows some warmth.

title: Château de la Jaubertie 2010 Mirabelle de la Jaubertie White (Bergerac Sec)
description: This wood-aged wine shows equal notes of toasty spice and ripe fruit. On the palate, it's full and round, with pear and apricot flavors giving it richness. This is concentrated and worth aging for another 2–3 years.

title: H. Blin NV L'Esprit Nature Extra Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This 2013-based wine is labeled Extra Brut, and Extra Brut it definitely is. Very crisp and tight with acidity, it hasn't a hint of flesh on its bare bones. The result is a Champagne that will need time to fill out and gain the richness it shows the potential for. Drink from 2019.

title: Archimedes 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: One of the producer's top wines, this wine is named both for Francis Ford Coppola's uncle and for the famous mathematician of ancient Greece. It does the men proud in its structured and refined components marked by black pepper, cinnamon and clove, as well as precision of tannin and grip, a powerful wine that's also sleekly smart.

title: Ramey 2013 Pedregal Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This wine was co-fermented with 15% Petit Verdot from the same rocky, hillside site. The two varieties marry seamlessly in the glass, exuding a distinct perfume of forest mushroom and violet. Though pronounced in structure the wine is also soft and round, with a dotting of dried herb and a considerable length of clove and dust. It's rich, intense and memorable.

title: Louis Jadot 2010 Le Clos Blanc Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: This is a round, rich and soft style of Chardonnay. It feels generous, and its yellow fruit flavor pushes through the acidity. It slowly opens to reveal complex tropical-fruit notes, and it will develop further, so give it another four years.

title: Charles Krug 2009 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Here's a softly rich Chardonnay that shows lots of appeal at a pretty good price. It's honeyed in pineapple, nectarine, guava and vanilla cream flavors, with a pretty overlay of sweetly smoked oak.

title: Icaria 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Icarus, in Greek myth, got too close to the sun. So did this wine from Icaria. It's not bad, but simply overripe. Has a sweet taste of raisins, in addition to the sweet smokiness from oak. Drink now.

title: Tarara 2011 Boneyard Red (Virginia)
description: Light to medium in body, this wine has a soft, malleable texture that bears just a touch of tannic traction. It tastes of waxy cherries and herbs, with a cinnamon note on the finish that fades in and out.

title: Covington 2010 Klipsun Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: It's quite tannic, as is to be expected from this founding Red Mountain vineyard, and yet the wine seems smoothed over, buffed out. The black cherry and cassis fruit does not penetrate. Drink up.

title: Château Gigognan 2012 Vignes du Prieuré Red (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Hints of vinyl or nail polish, chocolate and raisin distract a bit from the otherwise pleasant cherry-berry fruit. It's round in the mouth, with soft tannins, so drink it over the near term.

title: St. Francis 2013 Three Valleys Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Sweet, ripe tannins are embraced by a soft texture and touches of black pepper in this multiple appellation wine. Robust, if not bordering on crazy ripe, it needs food to find itself fully.

title: Apriori 2014 Sangiacomo Roberts Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Rustic on the nose, this is an earthy, herb-filled wine made in a robust style, juicy and exhibiting glassfuls of rhubarb and black tea. Integrated in terms of oak and tannin, it's youthful and may need some time to grow.

title: Joseph Drouhin 2012  Puligny-Montrachet
description: One of the trio of great white wine villages in the Côte de Beaune, Puligny-Montrachet makes the most classical wines. This village wine has the best of all worlds with its generous fruit and beautifully taut texture. It's ready to drink but will also age well. Drink now and until 2022.

title: Clayhouse 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: Sweet and acidic, with strong gooseberry flavors that veer into ammonia.

title: Adalia 2015 Singan  (Soave)
description: Here's a light-bodied casual wine that has subdued aromas suggesting white flower, orchard fruit and a hint of almond. You can find traces of the nose on the extremely simple diluted palate.

title: Clos Puy Arnaud 2012  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
description: Very fruity, very juicy, this wine is all about crisp, fresh fruitiness, starting with hand-picked biodynamic vineyard plots and gravity-flow into the winery. Red currants dominate, with considerable acidity right at the fore. At the back, the tannins are developing, but fruit will be the hallmark for the long future. Owner Thierry Valette's family also owns Château Troplong-Mondot in Saint-Émilion.

title: La Chanterelle 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Young, tight and sharp-toned upon first sniff, this broadens out and opens up with an hour or two of airing. The pinpoint focus brings black raspberry, black cherry and light hints of tobacco into play. The 30% new oak seems just right, although there is some burn in the finish from the high alcohol.

title: Thomas Fogarty 2012 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Asian pear, crisp lime juice and crushed chalk show on the nose of this very restrained wine from one of the region's top-tier producers. The palate is framed in lively acidity and strong minerality, presenting flavors of white rocks, lemon peel and brie rind. A nice amount of grip will ensure some aging potential too.

title: Keuka Spring 2013 Semi Sweet Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Rich, ripe yellow cherries and honeysuckle waft from this luxuriously honeyed off-dry Riesling. A sweet tangerine flavor is densely concentrated on the palate, yet the wine is sprightly and zesty in mouthfeel. An elegant floral spray extends the long, lingering finish.

title: Rex Hill 2015 Seven Soils Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Lush aromatics push a bouquet of toasted hazelnuts, citrus peel, apples and white peaches up from the glass. Flavors follow in a clean, spicy wine with a fresh and lively mouthfeel. One-third of the fruit was sourced from the estate's premier Jacob-Hart vineyard, and the wine spent 11 months in 20% new French oak.

title: Baron-Fuenté NV Esprit Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This ripe Chardonnay has a soft texture and only the lightest minerality. It is fresh, tangy with lemon-zest flavors and refreshing acidity. The aftertaste with a burst of crispness is particularly attractive.

title: Barberani 2012 Castagnolo  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)
description: Made from a blend of Grechetto, Procanico and other varieties, this charming wine from central Italy opens with aromas of tropical fruit, ripe yellow peach and a whiff of smoke. The palate offers flavors of pineapple, golden apple, and citrus, with a bitter almond note that unfolds on the finish.

title: Ruffino 2006 La Solatia Chardonnay (Toscana)
description: This charming Chardonnay-based white (with 10% Viognier) from Tuscany offers both strength and elegance. It sees three months of oak for softness and smoothness but also has pretty floral aromas that fill in the edges. Drink it with pasta or risotto.

title: Kopriva 2015 Unoaked Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Spicy acidity and a refreshing lift of lemon verbena highlight this unoaked wine, framing its medium body and lemon verbena, mandarin orange and grapefruit peel flavors.

title: Château d'Antugnac 2005 Aux Bons Hommes Red (Limoux)
description: A big, smooth, ripe wine, with rich raspberry-jam flavors and just gently dry tannins. This blend of Merlot with some Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon comes from vineyards 1,500 feet in the Limoux hills, yet it has the richness of a wine from warmer climate. Wood and spices add interest and richness.

title: Hendry 2005 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Here's an oaky, ripe Chardonnay. It has pleasant pineapple, peach and lemon flavors and crisp acidity, and while it's not especially complex, it's a nice Chard for drinking now.

title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2013 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This wine is wound extremely tight, but opens like a lotus with decanting or overnight patience. Aromas of rose buds, black-raspberry extract, wet clay and dried purple flowers show on the nose, bolstered by the slightest smoky kiss of oak. Savory flavors of roasted black-plum skins and elderberry meet with soy, graphite and loam on the palate, which will gain amazing tertiary flavors with time. Drink 2018–2028.

title: DanCin 2013 Tribute Red (Southern Oregon)
description: Tribute is a blend of 43% Barbera, 43% Sangiovese and 14% Nebbiolo—a difficult enterprise at best, particularly with fruit from young vines. It's thin and generic, showing no distinct varietal character.

title: Exem 2014  Bordeaux
description: The wine is soft with a toasty spicy character. That balances with the ripe berry fruits that are just on the stalky side of smooth. Drink this wine, with its fruity 70% Merlot, now.

title: Geyser Peak 1998 Kuimelis Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: It's shy in the nose, with suggestions of cassis and smoky oak, while the flavors veer toward berries and spices, swimming in firm tannins and sharp acidity. It's a delicate wine, one of finesse rather than power, but it is very good. A long, sweetly ripe finish suggests ageability, but it's probably at its youthful, fleshy best now.

title: Highlands 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Smoky oak enwraps fully developed layers of cherry and blackberry fruit in this thick wine packed with generous tannins. A hearty backbone of oak accents additional leather and dark chocolate flavors.

title: Boeger 2013 Walker Vineyard Zinfandel (El Dorado)
description: Purely delicious, this has stunning and distinctive aromas and flavors that recall pomegranate juice and blueberries, plus a velvety-smooth texture. While very full bodied, this wine does not win with power but with grace. It has excellent balance and harmony, and stands above the crowd.

title: Claar 2011 Estate Grown and Bottled Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine opens with aromas of vanilla and baking spices that are followed by broad, silky-feeling fruit and barrel flavors, finishing on a somewhat bitter note. The oak holds a prominent role but still plays its part well.

title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2014 Bernau Block Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Planted in 1983, this is the original Willamette Valley Vineyards estate vineyard. The wine remains stiff and wrapped up tight, with a mix of wild strawberry, raspberry and cherry fruit. There's a light dusting of baking spices, the result of aging 14 months in one-quarter new French oak.

title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2011 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Movie theater aromas of caramel candy, buttered popcorn and burned popcorn kernels converge on the nose of this classic Chardonnay from one of California's most historic vineyards. Despite the prominent nose, the flavors are elegantly restrained, with a brisk acidity surrounding warmer notes of caramelized pineapple.

title: Sineann 2009 Champoux Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: If any wine can blow away the thought that Merlot is a thin, wimpy, nondescript red, this is the wine. From the iconic Champoux Vineyard, it has magic and muscle, a broad and deep display of black fruits, coffee, licorice, dark chocolate, baking spices and beautifully built tannins. Explore and enjoy.

title: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2015 Seppi Landmann Zinnkoepfle Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: A rich, mellow whiff of vanilla and burnt sugar sweeps across the nose at first before appetizing tart notes of Granny Smith apple kick in. The palate is superfresh with these same green apple notes but also has a toasty mellowness adding and earthy charm and a richer, pithy texture. The finish is rounded but dry and lasting.

title: Roco 2014 Knudsen Vineyards Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Smooth and full bodied, this is packed with robust peach, pear, apple, lime and candied pineapple. There's a streak of vanilla custard from time in new oak, and length-extending minerality. This just keeps on going in the most delightful fashion.

title: Davis Estates 2012 Zephyr Private Reserve Red (Napa Valley)
description: A proprietary blend of 85% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Cabernet Franc, 3% Merlot and 2% Petit Verdot, Zephyr is thick and rich. It offers a ripe, juicy and soft expression of mocha, coconut and blackberry jam that's generous on the palate.

title: Romain Reverdy 2015 Florilège  (Sancerre)
description: The wine goes for the herbal side of Sauvignon Blanc with its green-fruit and gooseberry flavors. There is a grassy character that gives the wine its intensely crisp acidity. Drink this wine from 2018 so it can calm down.

title: Borrellie 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Bright and supple, this wine is vibrantly awash in red cherry, raspberry and whisps of vanilla, finishing lean and with plenty of versatility.

title: De Loach 2010 Estate Collection Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Tastes of perfectly ripened pineapple, pear, lime and peach flavors. On the structural side is fine acidity and a tangy minerality, like a lick of cold steel. Oak is here, notable but perfectly integrated. Give this Chard a little time in the glass to breathe.

title: Madrigal 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: Way too ripe, with raisiny, porty aromas and flavors that turn bitter on the finish.

title: Sinclair Estate Vineyards 2009 Pentatonic Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The blend is 51% Merlot, the rest divided among five other grapes, including Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Consequently, it's a bit of a mish-mash, fruity to the point of grapy, medium long, with the barrel flavors unresolved. Give this one another year or two of aging to allow all the components to come together.

title: Jacopo Biondi-Santi 2008 Castello di Montepò  (Morellino di Scansano)
description: Jacopo Biondi Santi hits a home run with this beautiful Morellino. The wine is smooth and dense, with lively cherry notes, soft spice and tobacco. It's straightforward and plush, but elegant at the same time.

title: Oak Knoll 2006 Red Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: From a vineyard in southern Oregon that is actually its own, self-contained AVA (Red Hill Douglas County), this is a well-structured Pinot Noir with grip and authority. There is a noticeable smokiness to both nose and palate, not unpleasant, and the fruit is tight and supple. Black cherry and blackberry flavors are set in charred wood tannins, but everything is in proportion and nicely developed.

title: Domaine Sainte-Eugénie 2009 Red (Corbières)
description: This wine needs some time to open up after pouring to fully express itself. With time, rich notes of black currant, brambly berry and black cherry grace the nose and mouth, with a touch of licorice root and espesso unfolding after swallow.

title: Lohsa 2000  Morellino di Scansano
description: Fresh and full, with a deep berry nose, drying tannins and ample but not overdone oak. In the mouth, it's pretty solid, and the cherry and black-plum fruit is clean and tasty. It's on the stout side, with youthful acidity and a good deal of warmth to the smoky finish. From Poliziano.

title: Frédéric Mallo 2010 Rosacker Grand Cru Vieilles Vignes Riesling (Alsace)
description: Subdued but promising apple-ripeness on the nose leads to a rounded, fully mature palate that rings with fresh and dried apple. There are hints of hay and and a wonderfully, clean core of lemon freshness that is supremely well cushioned on these rich, intense flavors. Drink 2016–2019.

title: Cathedral Ridge 2014 McDuffee Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (OR))
description: Smooth and lightly toasty, this offers plump, palate-pleasing tree fruits and a touch of vanilla custard. Just a tad lighter than the reserve from the same vintage and vineyard.

title: Mayacamas 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Lots of dry elegance in this wine. It's also more acidic than your typical Napa Cabernet, with a tart bite. The tannins are young and forceful, and the finish is totally dry. As presently constituted, it's somewhat tough and lean. But the core of cherries and blackberries suggests some degree of ageabilty. Hold until 2015.

title: Hudson-Chatham 2014 River's Edge Casscles Vineyards Red (New York)
description: A highly unusual blend of Burdin, a rare French hybrid, and Chambourcin grapes, this red wine offers delicate maraschino-cherry and berry flavors. It's a slightly fragile wine but whiffs of tobacco and garden soil lend complexity. The finish lingers on tart red fruit flavors and a hint of tannin.

title: LaVelle 2011 Four Brothers Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is the first release for the Four Brothers designation. Tastes of brown sugar flavors filling in around a thin core of barely ripe fruit. The sweet impression returns in the finish, this time with a lick of maple syrup.

title: Stacked Stone 2005 The Quarry Red (Paso Robles)
description: Made from the two Cabernets, Merlot and a drop of Petit Verdot, this is a gentle wine with some true complexity. It has interesting cherry flavor with a deeper stream of cassis liqueur.

title: Ironstone 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: A powerful, almost overbearing oak influence makes this wine bombastic. Toasty, maple sugar and smoked bacon flavors come from heavily charred new oak barrels or oak add-ins. It has a very dark color, full body, plenty of tannins and a smoky, oaky finish.

title: Henry Estate 2015 Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)
description: This is an elegant edition of the Henry Estate Pinot Noir. It has shed its rusticity in favor of a delicate expression of varietal character. Crushed rose petals, wild raspberries and a dash of pepper are backed with stiff tannins. Give it another year to fully come together.

title: Notre Vin 2006 Clos Madeleine Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a unique Pinot Noir, different from almost everything else out there. Sourced from a vineyard in the Petaluma Gap region (perhaps a future AVA), it's bone dry, moderate in alcohol, and tannic. It has lighter, leaner flavors than most Pinots, with the fruit accompanied by herbs, minerals, flowers and mushrooms. Fans of super-fruity Pinots will find it unrich, but Burgundy lovers may think of Pommard. It will be fascinating to track this wine's progress.

title: Pali 2012 Huntington Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Intensely ripe raspberry and cherry pie flavors mark this wine. Oak brings even greater richness, in the form of buttered cinnamon toast. The finish is dry, and there's a good burst of acidity. The alcohol is a little hot, but still, it's a nice, silky wine for drinking now.

title: Château la Garde 2014  Pessac-Léognan
description: This is a fine wood-aged blend of 57% Cabernet Sauvignon with Merlot and Petit Verdot. It is darkly colored, dense and with great ripe tannins. One of several Bordeaux properties owned by the Thiénot family, this estate occupies a fine, gravel outcrop in the Pessac-Léognan region, just south of Bordeaux. Drink from 2024.

title: Pianetta 2007 Estate Bottled Syrah (Monterey)
description: Lots of acidity and black pepper in this bone-dry wine, giving it a scoury mouthfeel. But you'll find very rich, elaborate blackberry and cherry jam, chocolate and bacon flavors. Drink now.

title: Brander 2015 Bouchet Red
description: Black cherry pie, milk chocolate and lilacs combine for a very accessible and rather lavish nose on this blend of 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc and 10% Merlot. It's easy to like on the sip, with candied purple fruit and licorice spice flavors, proving very fruity, lush and quaffable.

title: Babcock 1998 Fathom Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Made largely of Cabernet Franc, this wine has all the elements of first-rate Meritage: ripe blackberry and blueberry fruit, accompanied by a blast of smoky oak. It tastes good, too, with pure, sweet, supple berry flavors; yet, it's very dry, with ample acidity. It lacks the focus of North Coast claret-style wines, but is certainly among the best of the genre from the South Coast.

title: Duemani 2004 Suisassi Syrah (Toscana)
description: Luca D'Attoma and Elena Celli's new biodynamic Syrah exhibits opulent layers of soft chocolate, spice, red berry, leather and lingering tones of vanilla bean. In the mouth, the wine is chewy, tart and bursting with plump fruit flavors.

title: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2016 Collection Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Fresh easy notes of pear drop rise from the glass. The very slender palate has lemony freshness but also residual sweetness and a pithy phenolic edge. This is fresh, off dry and just balanced. Drink soon.

title: Ardor 2013 Art Den Hoed Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)
description: This captures attention with piercing cherry and cranberry aromas and with herb and orange-peel grace notes. The palate is soft, polished and layered, with a mouthfeel that dazzles and the flavors to back it up. The finish lingers.

title: Castello di Gabbiano 2010 Bellezza Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made with 100% Sangiovese, this conveys aromas of violet, vanilla, pressed powder and perfumed berry. The vibrant, structured palate delivers juicy wild cherry, licorice, black pepper and toast alongside firm tannins and fresh acidity. It finishes on a mocha note. Drink 2015–2022.

title: Kontos 2014 Les Collines Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The aromas are fresh, with notes of cranberry, red currant, baking spice and Red Vines. The palate is on the lighter side of medium bodied, trailing a bit on the finish. The vineyard, one of the state's top Syrah sites, doesn't seem to stand out as much as it typically does.

title: Fog Crest 2012 Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Warren Dutton planted the first vineyard block of this Russian River Valley producer, the Pinot a combination of Dijon and Pommard clones. In the hands of new winemaker Jerome Chéry, the wine is exotic in spicy cinnamon and cardamom, earthy and herbal with layers of dark cherry.

title: Fattorie Parri 2009 Tenuta Corfecciano Urbana Riserva  (Chianti Montespertoli)
description: Menthol, savory herb and dark-skinned berry aromas lead the nose along with a balsamic note. The full-bodied but accessible palate doles out black cherry, crushed plum, sage and soothing licorice alongside velvety tannins. Enjoy through 2016.

title: Sean Thackrey NV Pleiades XIX Old Vines Red (California)
description: With a translucent ruby color and silky texture, this could be a Pinot Noir. But it's a blend of Sangiovese, Voignier, Mourvèdre and several other varieties, and shows its own unique profile. Dry and crisp, the flavors are fruity, floral, herbal and spicy. Raspberries, cherries, thyme, white pepper, bacon, oregano and smoky sandalwood only begin to describe the complexities. They change by the second in the glass, but always finish dry.

title: Marshall Davis 2014 Seven Hills Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: Blackberry, anise and spice aromas are followed by rich full-fruit flavors. It's made in a hedonistic style that doesn't hold back.

title: Emile Beyer 2014 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Only very subdued notes of citrus emerge and add a little polish to a rounded, balanced and dry palate. However, a lovely, bundled ray of tangerine zestiness at the core brightens the wine immensely.

title: McManis 2011 Merlot (California)
description: Ripe and very dry, this has flavors of raisins, blackberries and dark chocolate, with a hint of smoky oak that adds richness.

title: Selvapiana 2013  Chianti Rufina
description: Elegant and fragrant, this opens with aromas of pressed rose, crushed violet, wild berry and a whiff of baking spice. The vibrant, focused palate delivers juicy red cherry, raspberry, white pepper, cinnamon and dried herb. It's well balanced, with supple tannins and bright acidity. Drink through 2018.

title: Quintet 2014 Lichtenwalter Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: Textural and spicy, this has a subtle mix of herb, salts, stem, leaf and wild berry flavors. It's fascinating and complex, with the sort of mystifying sex appeal that only Pinot Noir seems to be capable of. It spent 18 months in 30% new French oak to good effect.

title: DaMa 2010 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This spicy, elegant take on Syrah will reward your attention. Boysenberry and other purple/black fruits are expressed both aromatically and on the palate, with light touches of vanilla. The overall impression is of a pretty, structured, textural wine, with excellent length and balance.

title: Domaine François Schmitt 2014 Pfingstberg Grand Cru Paradis Riesling (Alsace)
description: Lemon notes are subdued by earth on the nose but they shine on a rather textured, palate that needs some air to open up. There is concentration at the core and generous freshness that lights up everything. Subtle but totally worthwhile with a clean lemon finish.

title: Rusack 2008 Ballard Canyon Estate Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: From Rusack's estate vineyard, this is a very fine, young Syrah. It shows rich blackberry, red currant, licorice, cocoa, smoked meat and sandalwood flavors, but is also quite tannic, and some of those tannins come from new oak. If you drink it now, give it a good decant. Should hold in the bottle for at least six years.

title: Ledson 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Made in the slightly sweet, crisp popular style, this Sauvignon Blanc offers easy flavors of pineapple, pear and apple juice, with the sweet vanilla of oak.

title: Sebastiani 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Soft and luscious, this has just enough tannin and acidity to give structure to the delicious black-cherry, cocoa and bacon flavors. Drink now.

title: Château Landat 2011  Haut-Médoc
description: This is dark and firm, with sufficient fruit to promise a rich future. The wine has ample weight, a solid, dense core and a juicy outer layer. Good for 3–5 years.

title: Charles Krug 2010 Family Reserve Generations Estate Red (Napa Valley)
description: A lovely wine, soft and supple, with a superb tannin structure framing the most interesting and delicious flavors. Blackberries, blueberries, red and black currants, anise and cedar notes all come together in balanced harmony, leading to a long, dry finish. Not an ager, but an elegant Napa Valley wine to drink now and over the next few years.

title: Gary Farrell 2014 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Made from one of the vineyard's historic blocks, this is a lush, inviting and complex wine, defined by golden honey apple and nutmeg. The texture is contoured and structured, with the richness of lemon meringue, but the balance is what stands out most. A tang of white pepper flirts on the finish.

title: Château Lilian Ladouys 2011  Saint-Estèphe
description: While the wood is still very apparent in this wine, it does also have the rich fruit as a balance. The acidity, dark berry fruits and a fine juicy character go with the firm tannins and spicy wood character. Drink from 2017.

title: Francis Coppola 2009 Diamond Collection Emerald Label Pinot Grigio (California)
description: A semisweet wine, with apricot jam and citrus flavors, offset by crisp acidity. Turns cloying after a few sips.

title: Château Haut Barrail 2013  Médoc
description: Almost ready to drink now, this is a rounded, smooth wine with only light tannins but plenty of fruitiness. It's not a big wine, balanced and juicy with attractive fruits. Drink from 2017.

title: Three Saints 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Dry and firmly tannic, this Cab has upfront flavors of black currants, plums, mocha and cedary oak. There's some sharpness in the texture that limits ageability, but it's a pretty wine for now.

title: Hourglass 2006 Blueline Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Very big and smoky, an impressive young Merlot that grabs you by the collar and shakes you. Made by the veteran Robert Foley, it's in his style, a ripe, powerful wine exuding massive flavors of black cherries, cassis and chocolate.

title: Robert James Wines 2015 Little Fox Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: There's a diluted nature to this wine, from a selection of varietal clones. Dry, it holds back on flavor, delivering a light texture and soft red-fruit flavors.

title: Lone Madrone 2014 Sheep Camp Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Winemaker Neil Collins spends his time diving into the region's little known, dry-farmed old vines to deliver distinctive and delicate Zinfandels. This one shows wet riverstone scents, with smashed blackberry and lavender. The palate offers tart black plum, peppercorn and tar touches.

title: Château Franc le Maine 2008  Saint-Émilion
description: Tannic and dry, this wine is beginning to show its age. It still has some juicy red fruits but they are covered by the firm structure and dusty character of the wine. It needs to be drunk now.

title: Red Newt Cellars 2014 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Hints of smoke and bramble linger from nose to finish, lending a savory complexity to this dry-style Riesling. It's spry and invigorating, juxtaposing tart pineapple and lemon flavors against a backdrop of pressed apple and pear. The finish extends long with an elegant mineral tinge.

title: Glenora 2013 Signature White (Finger Lakes)
description: Juicy, ripe peach and blossom notes perfume this full bodied blend of Chardonnay, Riesling and Pinot Blanc. It's moderately concentrated, with delicate flavors of fresh stone fruit, pear and toast, but enlivened by a streak of sunny lemon acidity. Finishes briskly.

title: Klipfel 2011 Cuvée Particulière Riesling (Alsace)
description: This is a soft, rather unfocused wine that is pleasantly fruity with flavors of apples and currants. It's lightly perfumed and ready to drink now.

title: Dehlinger 2013 Goldridge Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Goldridge honors the soil series so important in the appellation, offering floral aromas that lead into silky-smooth texture with tension. Earthy, it conjures notions of fresh-picked strawberry, black tea and kirsch, with an approachability that doesn't distract from its complexity.

title: Banfi 2009 Poggio alle Mura Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)
description: This firmly structured wine opens with toasted aromas, baked plum, fennel and a licorice note. The palate offers dried cherry, fig, roasted coffee bean and anisette alongside bracing tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Red Car 2010 Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: The winery's larger-scale Syrah (and that's still under 2,000 cases), this is a friendly, sophisticated Rhône-inspired wine grown on the cooler Sonoma Coast. Red and blue fruits are expertly ripe and high-toned, accented by layers of classic cool-climate spice.

title: Montemercurio 2007 Damo  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Damo has earthy fragrances of tobacco leaf, underbrush and truffle, along with notes of raspberry and spice. The palate shows ripe black cherry, vanilla and sweet spice flavors, as well as a hint of licorice. This has nice depth and balance, but will be more complex after 2017.

title: Le Bèrne 2011  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Blue flower, ripe plum and baking spice aromas lead the nose on this robust wine. The palate lacks fruit richness, offering dried black cherry, licorice, dark spice and searing alcohol alongside assertive, drying tannins.

title: Novelty Hill 2010 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The vineyard-designated wines from Novelty Hill consistently reflect the site in terms of a deep-seated earthy, herbal character. It's quite like a modern Bordeaux, taking the cassis fruit as a base and cloaking it with toasted flavors from earth and barrel.

title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Horse Heaven Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Coming from the warm 2013 vintage, this is an aromatic offering, with notes of pineapple, kiwi, herbs and oak spices (40% barrel fermented). It's creamy in feel, but with tart, vibrant acidity that keeps the palate fresh and lively.

title: Chateau St. Jean 2010 Cinq Cepages Red (Sonoma County)
description: Based on Cabernet Sauvignon, this blend has rich, pleasant cherry, currant and mocha flavors, enhanced with sweet toasty oak. A soft, luscious wine with a lot of popular appeal, it's drinking beautifully now.

title: Pey-Marin 2007 The Shell Mound Riesling (Marin County)
description: This was one of the best Rieslings of the year last vintage, and the '07 is even better. It's absolutely dry and superbly racy. Acidity, at .82, is one of the highest I've seen in years. Balancing that is a broad, complex array of citrus, peach, apple, flower, petrol, mineral and spice flavors. If California Riesling is making a comeback, it's because of wines like this.

title: Wofford Acres 2007 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (El Dorado)
description: Good flavors of blackberries, currants and cedar in this wine, with a rich, chocolately edge. There are problems with the structure, though, that lead to a sharp, prickly mouthfeel. Drink now.

title: Valle dell'Asso 2007 Galatina Chardonnay (Galatina)
description: This is a Chardonnay-based wine with aromas of white mineral, stone fruit and passion fruit. It is an easy, no-fuss wine that would pair well with light salad lunches or sandwich snacks.

title: Vino 2013 Pinot Grigio (Ancient Lakes)
description: Light mineral and lemon-rind aromas are followed by dry, tart flavors. It should shine on the dinner table.

title: Castle Rock 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)
description: An attractive floral, appley aroma and generous, ripe apple and herb flavors give this medium-bodied wine plenty of personality.

title: Terre del Marchesato 2013 Inedito Red (Toscana)
description: A 50-50 blend of Merlot and Syrah, this easygoing wine opens with aromas of red currant, graphite and cracked peppercorn. The lively palate offers blackberries, blueberries and clove alongside tangy acidity and dusty tannins.

title: Riverbench 2012 Cork Jumper Rosé Blanc de Noirs Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Red apples, sourdough bread, cherry blossoms and strawberry zest show on the nose of this ever-so-slightly pink wine. The sipping experience is reminiscent of a fizzy, foamy mouthful of Pop Rocks flavored by sour cherries, altogether fun, tart and delicious.

title: Graveyard 2014 Graveyard Vineyard Reserve Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: The nose on this bottling shows fresh boysenberry and primary grape scents, with lots of sweet rosemary and purple flower nuance. The sip is not overly complicated, with tar at first and then waves of blackberry and boysenberry fruit, lifted by thyme and peppercorns.

title: Giuseppe Campagnola 2009 Vigneti Vallata di Marano  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: Here's a straightforward Amarone, with dense black fruit and spice aromas. The palate delivers blackberry, plum and raisin flavors, with white pepper and chocolate accents. It doesn't have a lot of complexity, but is delicious and ready to drink.

title: Clos Pegase 2013 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine consists of all five red Bordeaux varieties plus 5% Syrah. Tart, soft and juicy with black and red cherry fruit, it's direct in its delivery of dried herb and licorice—flavors that complement the robust ripeness and density.

title: Sutcliffe 2009 Canyon of the Ancients Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Colorado)
description: Although the aromas of cassis, spiced blackberry, maduro and dried herb are restrained on first sniff, with some air and coaxing they become more assertive. The medium-bodied palate has a pliant core, and the tightly coiled tannins come alive on the finish.

title: Cowhorn 2011 Sentience Syrah (Applegate Valley)
description: Tart and tannic, this has a sleek, almost steely character, with cranberry and black cherry fruit, razor's edge tannins, and supporting acidity.

title: Elk Cove 2014 Clay Court Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: A standout among the winery's single-vineyard selections, this big-boned effort brings flavors of chewy cherry alongside a citrus highlight and a definite underpinning of wet stone and clay. Texturally compelling, it should age gracefully through 2024.

title: Foxen 2015 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: The impressively plump and prominent strawberry and red-currant aromas are alluring on the nose, enhanced by touches of cinnamon and pepper dust. The palate combines savory pepper spice, red plums and berries, with a solidly simmering acidity shimmering through the entire sip.

title: RouteStock 2011 99W Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a light and fruity wine that's forward on the palate, with red berries and hints of orange peel. It leaves a tart, citrusy aftertaste.

title: Doukénie 2011 Pinot Grigio (Virginia)
description: Aromas of bees wax and clover honey come with some volatility. The palate tastes a touch bitter and high pitched, and the acidity feels flat. A note of honey-infused breakfast tea surfaces on the palate.

title: Il Paradiso di Frassina 2009  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Leafy aromas suggest forest underbrush, dried tobacco leaf and dried rose petals. The palate offers fading wild cherry, hints of cinnamon-spice and astringent, fleeting tannins. It seems fast forwarded by a decade, a trait of this vintage. Superior Wines, V I Wines Distributing.

title: Va Piano 2011 Estate Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Rich and aromatic, this black label reserve displays excellent power and concentration. A dense core of cassis, licorice and espresso is brightened with vivid acidity, slowing fading through a long, smoky finish. Wait until 2016 for optimum enjoyment.

title: Lail 2010 Blueprint Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This 100% Sauvignon Blanc is forward in citrus, floral, spice and honey flavors, brightened with crisp acidity. A little heavy and full bodied, this has a touch of green gooseberry that makes it exotic and New Zealand style.

title: Bravium 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is an engaging, nervy wine, with a light, savory aroma and tangy red-cherry flavors riding on a firm frame of fine-grained tannins and good acidity. It does not try to overwhelm with superripe fruit or oak, but just lets the purity of the grapes shine through.

title: Quintet 2013 Ribbon Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: This wine brings spicy cranberry and strawberry, underscored with a whiff of leather. Flavors punch down and finish strong, with a leathery note that does not preclude the solid fruit.

title: Left Coast Cellars 2010 Suzanne's Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The winery's top cuvée, this offers barely ripe rhubarb and cranberry fruit flavors, with heavy tannins tasting of green coffee. The finish has a slight bitterness, but the wine overall shows medium concentration and depth, and could be cellared for a few more years to smooth it out.

title: Gustave Lorentz 2013 Burg Riesling (Alsace)
description: Fresh notes of ripe lemon zest are suffused with hay flower and earth notes. The palate majors on zesty, lively and aromatic citrus: tangerine and Amalfi lemon above all. This is dry and bright, slender and precise, yet never lets go of its earthy touch. The finish is expansive and clean.

title: Bianchi 2009 Signature Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Twin unbalanced notes of vegetables and raisins mar this Cabernet. It's very soft and finishes with notes of prunes and milk chocolate.

title: Minassian-Young 2010 Field Blend Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of Mourvèdre and Counoise is soft and sweet. It tastes like the wine version of a milk-chocolate candy bar, infused with blackberry essence and alcohol.

title: Ben Ish NV Ben's Select Red (California)
description: Richly fruity, this wine has a smooth texture and well-concentrated black-plum flavors along with a lightly spicy, bread dough accent that adds interest. It's a touch sweet and supported by light tannins.

title: Evergreen 2006 Spruce Goose Riesling (Willamette Valley)
description: This estate-grown Riesling brings fresh apples and white peaches to the table. Fresh and concentrated, it hits a generous 13.6% alcohol, with suggestions of sweetness from the quite ripe fruit, although it is technically dry. It seems to have real potential for aging and developing over a decade or more.

title: Sinor-LaVallee 2013 Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Using fruit mostly from the Bassi Ranch property he recently acquired, Mike Sinor delivers a bright, minerally wine, with aromas of scratched grapefruit skin, orange and peach juice, burned lemons, sea salt, ripe apples and nectarines and fresh-cut herbs. Flavors of salty, lime-juice nectarines emerge once sipped, with hints of butter and white flowers.

title: Maison Bouey 2013 Château Lestruelle  (Médoc)
description: Consultant Stéphane Derenoncourt has helped this light wine to have a good balance and soft, generous fruitiness. The tannins are kind, rounded and already well integrated with the fruit. Drink from 2017.

title: Straccali 2010  Chianti
description: This blend of Sangiovese and Canaiolo is enhanced with a small percentage of Merlot. That addition heightens the wine's softness and renders a richer mouthfeel.

title: Trinchero 2009 Mario's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Made in a ripe, oaky style, this 100% Cabernet has powerful blackberry and cassis flavors that are a little warm. Its 95% new French oak is evident in the smoke, vanilla, toast and caramel notes. It's a very tannic wine that locks down the palate with dry astringency. All indications suggest the cellar. Give it at least eight years.

title: Matchbook 2013 Tinto Rey Red (Dunnigan Hills)
description: This is a mouthfilling wine that doesn't go over the top in terms of ripeness or tannins, so it's smooth to drink and offers mild plum and cherry flavors.

title: Jax 2005 Y3 Syrah (Napa Valley)
description: Marked by jammy fruit and high acidity, this Syrah is strong in cherries, raspberries and oak. It's not especially subtle, but it is pretty and polished, and could even acquire bottle complexity over the next 3–4 years.

title: Château le Sartre 2012  Pessac-Léognan
description: While the tannins are very present in this wine, it also has good acidity and blackberry fruits. It's firm and structured in the front, still young, although allowing plenty of room for the fruit to show strongly over the next few years. Drink from 2019.

title: Bonaccorsi 2008 Larner Vineyard Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A pretty wine, with a touch of wintergreen mint and bacon fat adding complexity to the blackberries, cherries and cassis. Co-fermented with some Viognier, it's vibrant in the mouth, with a welcome cut of acidity to brighten and uplift the fruit. A flashy, elegant, opulent Syrah to drink over the next several years.

title: Testarossa 2012 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Vanilla-soaked French toast and caramelized apples promise a butter bomb in this Testarossa take on the historic Sierra Madre Vineyard in the Santa Maria Valley. Once sipped, there is a surprising level of soda-like acidity, and a steadily emerging flavor profile that ranges from cream soda to squeezed lime.

title: No Girls 2012 La Paciencia Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Peat, flower, smoked meat and earthy funk aromas are at the fore. The flavors show a combination of richness and elegance, with smoked meat and olive brine flavors that linger.

title: Castello Monaci 2013 Liante Red (Salice Salentino)
description: A blend of Negroamaro and Malvasia Nera, this opens with aromas of underbrush, violet, clove and spicy plum. The straightforward palate delivers mature blackberry and allspice alongside brawny tannins.

title: Corvallis Cellars 2011 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a solid effort, especially at this price point. The cherry-cola core of flavor grabs your interest quickly, and hangs on with a hint of tobacco in the smooth finish. Some nice acidity adds a touch of minerality.

title: Martorana 2006 Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Good blackberry, black cherry, cola and spice flavors in this Merlot. It's marked by the jagged, sandpapery tannins that often accompany Dry Creek red wines. You can call it rustic, but it's rustic-chic, an interesting wine with some real complexity.

title: Mercer 2008 McKinley Springs Vineyard Syrah (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Quite oaky, the barrel flavors not yet integrated into the fruit, this starts out rough, then rolls into clean, light, pleasant boysenberry fruit flavors. Should continue to improve with more time in the bottle.

title: Domaine Loubejac 2013 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: A négociant effort, this was done entirely in stainless steel and neutral oak. Tart and light, it has simple strawberry fruit with a touch of spice. It offers no tricks, just straight-ahead Pinot at a modest price for Oregon.

title: Sparrow Hawk 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Weighty in cinnamon, this wine is soft and entirely spicy throughout, medium in weight and slightly complex. Blackberry and black cherry play off the firm tannins and structured oak, providing girth but not overindulgence.

title: Montemercurio 2013 Petaso  (Rosso di Montepulciano)
description: Chopped herb, underbrush, truffle and balsamic notes lead the nose. The palate is fresh, vibrant and polished, offering sour cherry fruit with a hint of licorice. A sage note closes the finish.

title: The Full 2012 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Orange, pineapple and mango fruit flavors characterize this simple wine. It's candied on the finish, with plenty of acidity for balance.

title: Eberle 2013 Vineyard Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Blackberry jelly meshes with enticing aromas of hot gingerbread on the nose of this bottling by regional pioneer Gary Eberle. Dark chocolate, coffee, black cherry, loam, crushed herbs and graphite all play into the layered palate, held strongly by firm tannins.

title: Montevetrano 2010 Montevetrano Red (Colli di Salerno)
description: This structured yet polished wine, made from a blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Aglianico and 20% Merlot, opens with intense aromas of tilled earth, mature black fruit, leather, graphite and spice. The Juicy palate offers fleshy blackberry, black currant, black pepper and mineral alongside silky smooth tannins. Hold for more complexity. Drink 2015–2025.

title: Turiya 2011 Shapeshifter Red (Central Coast)
description: There's magic in this 65% Petit Verdot and 35% Sangiovese combination. This shows concentrated cherry and kirsch aromas, touches of shiitake and porcini mushrooms and plenty of turned, wet earth aromas. The palate, framed by chalky tannins, offers more mushrooms and truffles in a black cherry-chocolate gravy, proving quite luxurious and interesting at once.

title: Pearmund 2013 Old Vine Meriwether Vineyard Chardonnay (Virginia)
description: Muddled citrus and a drizzle of artificial butter initially marks the nose and palate. Additional notes of bitter lemon peel and roasted pear carry the flavors to a slightly astringent finish.

title: Villa Pillo 2005 Sant'Adele Merlot (Toscana)
description: Villa Pillo's Sant'Adele is probably Italy's best Merlot at this price point. The wine is soft and smooth with beautiful intensity of aromas that spans from red fruit to sweet spice. It demonstrates clarity and balance with a velvety, opulent style and a crisp close.

title: Tower 15 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: What a nice Sauvignon Blanc this is. It's crisp and delicately structured, with light, airy flavors of limes, dried hay, pineapple zest and white pepper.

title: Clautiere 2005 BDX Estate Grown Red (Paso Robles)
description: All fruit and little structure. Blasts the palate with blackberries, cherries, chocolate, currant, vanilla and pastry flavors that are functionally sweet. Acidity is soft, emphasizing the glyceriney sweetness.

title: Schröder & Schÿler 2012 Chartron la Fleur Merlot-Cabernet  (Bordeaux)
description: This soft, ripe wine is a blend of 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon. With black-currant fruit and bright acidity, the wine is fruity and ready to drink.

title: ZD 2013 45th Anniversary Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Rounded in baked and dried fruit aromas, this is a soft, gentle wine with tangy acidity and swathes of ripe apple and orange citrus. A backbone of subtle oak gives it structure and complexity, finishing lean and bright, with a darker, richer twist of vanilla and clove in the mix.

title: Vignobles Brumont 2012 Château Bouscassé Les Jardins  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)
description: This blend of the very local Petit Courbu and Petit Manseng grapes comes from the same region as Madiran. The wine is dry but rich—very rich—with apricot and honey flavors. It has concentration, a great tang of lemon and just enough acidity to keep everything in order. This is ready to drink.

title: Array 2013 Nina's Reserve Chardonnay (Washington)
description: Sur lie aging and battonage were extended for 22 months on this wine. It displays aromas of corn silk, almond milk and lees that are followed by an elegant creamy mouthfeel and abundant stone-fruit flavors. The finish lingers.

title: Voss 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Green bean and bell pepper mark this wine that lacks flavor. It tastes watery and diluted, a faint hint of lemon lurking in.

title: Philippe Colin 2014 Les Chaumées Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)
description: This comes from the northern end of the line-up of Premier Crus, which shows in the lively, crisp and tightly fruity character of the wine. It is developing slowly, still controlled and with light hints of toast. It will be a beautiful, bright wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Gary Farrell 2005 Russian River Selection Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This multivineyard blend isn't cheap, but it's almost as good as Farrell's more expensive single-vineyard Pinots, which makes it kind of a value. Like them, it's a dry, crisply acidic wine, and slightly austere. It shows tobacco-infused cherry pie filling, pomegranate, rhubarb and cola flavors.

title: Ojai 2005 Roll Ranch Vineyard Syrah (California)
description: Despite the California appellation, the grapes were grown in the Ojai region of Santa Barbara County. It's a dry, tannic wine whose ripe blackberry, mocha and oak flavors are balanced with rich earthiness. Could develop bottle complexity over the next six years.

title: Flora Springs 2008 Trilogy Red (Napa Valley)
description: A flashy, classy wine, grown in the estate vineyard in the benchlands and hills above Rutherford. Shows lots of sweet, ripe cherry fruit and toasty oak, but has enough of an acid-tannin structure to dry it out for balance. Should hold and develop over the next 6–8 years.

title: Atalon 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Dry and crisp with acidity, this Sauvignon Blanc, with 3% Sémillon, was fermented in stainless steel but partially aged in neutral oak barrels. The palate shows complex flavors of citrus fruits, Asian pears, lychee, cashews, vanilla, minerals and white pepper, with a touch of honey. The grapes come from all around the valley, including the cooler Oak Knoll district as well as warmer St. Helena. A brilliant example of blending, and easy to find, with 10,000 cases produced.

title: Papapietro Perry 2007 Pauline's Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: An interesting wine to dissect. It's very tannic, rather hot in alcohol, and super-spicy, with ripe to ultraripe flavors of wild blackberries, raspberries and currants. Feels a bit rustic and uncoordinated now, but could gain smoothness in a year or two. Certainly it's a very good example of Dry Creek Zin.

title: Insania 2009 Red (Red Mountain)
description: Produced by Three Rivers for celebrity winemaker Geoff Tate, the Insania is actually rather tame. Pretty fruit flavors of berry, cherry and plum introduce the wine gracefully, then run into some stiff, drying, chalky tannins.

title: Falkner 2012 Amante Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Italian varietals can excel in this SoCal zone, and this Sangiovese-led Super Tuscan blend is a prime example, with crushed graphite, tobacco, juicy blackberry and woodpile notes on the nose. Dried oregano, marjoram and thyme arise on the palate, with a sultry baked-plum flavor on the midpalate and pencil shavings and incense throughout.

title: Stephen Ross 2014 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Mexican lime, crushed chalk, light jasmine, daffodil and lemon-lime soda show on the nose of this bottling by veteran Steve Dooley. Tight cement and lime-rind flavors pop on the palate, where a sharp kumquat quality dissects the Bosc-pear warmth and the nuanced influence of damp dill and other green herbs.

title: Manzoni 2012 Home Vineyard Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Black pepper, graphite and reluctant boysenberry notes balance the rubbery funk on the nose of this cool-climate Syrah. It's fairly light on the palate, with just-ripe boysenberry and chopped Italian herbs.

title: Double Eagle 2012 Grieve Family Vineyard Red (Napa Valley)
description: Merlot from the family's vineyard in Lovall Valley informs the majority of this blend at 44%, with 36% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Cabernet Franc in the wine as well. Dry and herbal, it sings in bold notes of red currant, cedar and anise, offering elegance around integrated tannins and a mouthcoating finish. Drink now through 2022.

title: Hooker 2011 Home Pitch Block 1 Syrah (Knights Valley)
description: Jammy blackberry and cherry fruit flavors mark this wine, along with some strong tannins. It's not particularly complex, and doesn't have the balance for aging, so drink up.

title: Happy Camper 2011 Merlot (California)
description: Drink this sharp, sweetish Merlot if someone gives it to you at a barbecue and don't complain. Put extra ketchup on the burger and enjoy.

title: Château Lilian Ladouys 2014  Saint-Estèphe
description: Under the ownership of Jacky Lorenzetti, president of one of France's top rugby clubs, this estate is now performing impressively. The wine is finely structured with dark tannins and tight acidity and a hint of minerality. It is Merlot dominated, although it is the 40% Cabernet Sauvignon that brings out the black-currant fruitiness. Drink from 2022.

title: Mazzei 2004 Poggio alla Badiola Sangiovese (Toscana)
description: Sangiovese with 25% Merlot for added softness and dimension, this wine boasts pretty notes of cherry, blue flowers, toasted almonds and exotic spice. It has nice elegance overall but is a bit compact in the mouth.

title: Girard 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: An 85% Zinfandel with smaller amounts of Petite Sirah, Mourvèdre and Syrah, this red offers sanguine, rustic plum, cinnamon spice and a concentration of bright red fruit, a lingering grip on the finish.

title: Domaines Schlumberger 2012 Kessler Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: There are mere hints of beeswax and marzipan on the nose. The palate opens into a structured, bright and well-lit space of pear peel, pear juice and a wonderfully bitter edge. This is off-dry and concentrated, definite but with a light touch. There is an intriguing hint of bitter orange peel that draws you in and pull this onto a higher plane.

title: Terre Rouge 2013 L'Autre Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: Flavors like wild berries blend with smoke and rosemary in this full-bodied, full-flavored and firmly tannic wine. It is big in texture and high in aromatic intensity. Made of 72% Grenache, 19% Syrah and 9% Mourvèdre.

title: Liberty School 2014 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Extremely light on aromas, this bottling eventually shows lemon peel, chalk and slate. The palate is simple yet clean, with flavors of pear, nectarine and lime peels.

title: Alexana 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This rosé brings extra levels of finesse and detail along with the expected burst of fresh fruit. Elegant and sophisticated, it offers tart cherry fruit, some peppery herb and a hint of fresh-ground coffee. Barrel fermented in neutral oak, it's smooth as silk.

title: Tyler Florence 2009 Blend #5 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a soft, somewhat one-dimensional Cab. It has jammy flavors of blackberries and cherries, with the vanilla and toast of oak barrel aging. Drink now.

title: Patz & Hall 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: A well-crafted blending from several marquee vineyards within the producer's portfolio, this is a subtle, flirty and floral white, vibrant and dusted in minerality. An intense back beat of oak and power balances on the finish, in between a flurry of complex, compelling pear, apple and salty hazelnut.

title: Maryhill 2010 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Chalky and dry, this tastes of barely ripe cherry, with plenty of leafy flavors. The tannins take over quickly in a brief, drying finish.

title: Columbia Crest 2012 Reserve Chardonnay (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Despite the wine being fermented and aged in 100% new French oak, the fruit shines through, with notes of corn silk, peach and tropical fruit accented by barrel spices. Texture and richness to the sweet fruit flavors keeps interest high.

title: Foxen 2009 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: With 50% new oak aging, the wood stands out now, showing caramelized and buttered toast flavors. Under that is a dry, tannic wine, filled with raspberries, cherries and spicy pomegranates. Complex and pedigreed, it wants some time in the cellar. Better after 2014.

title: Cedarville Vineyard 2012 Turnabout's Fair Play Red (Fair Play)
description: Hints of charred wood and fresh-cracked black pepper meet tasty baked-fruit flavors in this full-bodied, rather rugged wine made from Grenache, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. It has a good, firm and moderately tannic texture.

title: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2013 Altenberg-Bergbieten Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: A touch of evolution is immediately apparent: that chamomile lift and dried citrus peel nose gives it away. The  dry palate then serves up notions of ripe but tart apple, incisive lemon freshness and a more generous, fluid rich texture that play off each other beautifully. On the finish it is the lemon that shines, alongside some notions of candle wax and more chamomile. A lovely snapshot of a Riesling on its trajectory. Drink 2017-2027.

title: Elyse 2012 Hossfeld Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: From a vineyard 1,500 feet above the valley floor in Soda Canyon, blended with 4% Cabernet Sauvignon from Morisoli Vineyard, this is a beautiful beast of a wine, concentrated in red cherry and plum as well as mocha. Nicely weighted with soft tannin and length, it's well made and should age. Drink now through 2020.

title: Pisoni 2006 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Exceptionally fine. Effortlessly combines the impressive power and authority the vineyard is known for with sensual elegance. The flavors of currants, cherries, cola, balsam and clovespice are mouth-watering. Such is the balance of tannins, acids, oak and all other parts that the wine should improve over the next six years, then hold for several more.
